group_1.progressNarration: Of the first four stories I have to share,@this one I received from@Sudachi of Puella Care.
It is the tale of the Kamihama Magia Union.
At that time, none of us could have foretold@just what the future had in store for us.
[textBlack:In Kagome's place, I, Sudachi Sawa,@decided to go see how the@Kamihama Magia Union was doing.]

[textBlack:While I was walking around looking for@Mifuyu, everyone looked like they were@feeling uncertain, probably because word@of the plan to ally with Promised Blood@had spread throughout the group.]
[textBlack:I think that uncertainty makes sense,@considering how Promised Blood went as@far as sending in spies to massacre the@Magical Girls of Kamihama City.]

[textBlack:But I guess it's a little more complicated@than that. Thanks to the tricky tactics@Yuna used and the troubles with@Kamihama's elections happening so close@together, it seems that the people from the@East lost their trust in those from the West.]
[textBlack:I could see what they meant.@Mii and I also got harassed by@someone from the West when we@went to the Tomorrow Shop earlier.]

group_1.textCenter: I'm guessin' you two're also gonna@head on back in a little while?

group_1.textRight: Yeah, let's hang out near the school again after@the situation's calmed down a little more.

group_1.textLeft: Besides, if Mito gets tired out from all the@fun and shows up late again, it won't be pretty.

group_1.textRight: I mean, I didn't sleep in at all today,@I woke up just fine...
It's just, when I thought of going to school,@it made me feel really bummed out...

group_1.textLeft: What the heck?!@That's really going at your own pace!

group_1.textRight: Ehehe.
I can kinda get why Mito's feeling that way...
...Leila, you're hiding it, but deep down@you feel the same, right...?

group_1.textLeft: Ah...
...Yeah, to be honest, I was feeling@really down this morning too...

group_1.textCenter: I knew it, you girls are all here!

group_1.textLeft: Miss Coordinator! And Kanagi too!

group_1.textRight: Our meeting here is no coincidenceâ€•@We've been waiting for you three.

group_1.textLeft: So ya need us for something?

group_1.textRight: Indeed. Maybe you've heard@from Yakumo or myself,
but we're asking around to learn how the Magical@Girls of the East feel about the West.
Did anything in particular change?

group_1.textLeft: ...Actually, that's a lie.
It's probably wrong to say that@nothing at all changed, but...
Talk of Magical Girls of the East@being sold out by the West...
I heard that was part of Promised Blood's strategy,@but...
The feeling of distrust still remains...
Yeah, we're trying to join hands@with Promised Blood, of all people.
For those of us in the East, it's like our feelings@of being toyed with are now being made light of...

group_1.textRight: And I'm kinda scared of the West, too, a little.
I heard Mikage got hurt by a kid from there, too...

group_1.textLeft: Eh?! Is that for real?!

group_1.textRight: Yeah, she got a rock thrown at@her at the Tomorrow Shop...
And because of that, I found it@kinda hard to go to school today...
Mii's incident may have happened, but don't pass@judgment on all of the West based on one case.
At the very least, we don't plan on changing@how we view every Magical Girl equally.
Teaming up with Promised Blood may@seem insensitive, but as they say,
"Inscrutable are the ways of heaven." This proposal@is only possible because the situation has improved.

group_1.textLeft: Right...

group_1.textRight: (Trust in the West is the main issue, huh.)
(To think that Yuna Kureha's strategy, slow as it@may be, would have such a profound impact...)

group_1.textLeft: If there was proof the West wasn't@colluding with Promised Blood...

group_1.textRight: Yeah...
And besides, this talk of teaming@up with Promised Blood...
Even if we aren't, everyone else's makin' a stink.

group_1.textLeft: People have died, and many others@came close to being killed...
Even if people aren't opposing it outright,@they're definitely really nervous.
We've got our work cut out for us, Kanagi...

group_1.textRight: Indeed...  While it's true that dissatisfaction with@the election may be particularly strong in the East...
...It seems that both sides are uncommonly@united in their dislike for this turn of events.

group_1.textLeft: It's just like Yachiyo and the others said...
